reasons:
My Name is Nimai
I am currently completing Year 10 at Camberwell High School (CHS).
As part of the 2017 Careers and Pathways Program I have to complete one week of Work Experience.
I am a dedicated bike rider and I have an eager interest in the construction and maintenance of bikes.
I am really keen to learn about any aspect of the design, construction, repair and production of bicycles.
This would support my Year 10 objectives and provide me a valuable real-world insight into a local industry success and discover more about my options beyond school.
I am a capable and independent learner with a great aptitude, resilience and sense of team.
The dates set by CHS are the 26 - 30th of June 2017.
I have completed a Work Safe â€œGeneral Moduleâ€ and understand general professional workplace demands.
It would be awesome to have an opportunity to spend a week with your company and team for my Work Experience.
I am really hopeful and looking forward to hearing back from you soon.

I used to have a bike but got stolen.

I'm interested in bike maintenance and love to have the hands-on experience in this area.

Bikes make life better - but it s so expensive to get your bike repaired in a store, And if you want to do it yourself you have to buy tools... cycling should be available for everyone! I want to do vulenteer until i find a job as a mechanic ... my background is industrial engineer. My problem is not to find a job - i want to do the job which is good with my mission and view of the world i want to live in...

I started learning basic bicycle maintenance over the last 4 months after my girlfriend started to get involved with the sport, and I guess I got dragged into it with her. Since then I ride 5-6 days a week and have retired my car in favour of 2 wheels. In the last 4 months I have spent at least 100 hours at The Bikery (a non-profit bike shop based at Monash University) building up bikes, helping people fix their bikes and learning as much as I possibly can. To say I'm obsessed would probably be an understatement. I love riding, building and helping others both find the sport and to get back on the road - Volunteering scratches all of those itches. One day I hope to become a paid mechanic, but for now I'm just happy being up to my elbows in bike parts and grease while hopefully passing on my love for hitting the road. I have a lot of time to spare during the week so I'm hoping to use this time to learn as much as possible.
Bicycle courier injured at the moment, would like to learn more about bike mechanics

I love bikes and am happy to help fix them when I can.

I miss working on regular bikes, but am a mechanic for Green Cabs and run Melbourne Rickshaw.

Hope to hear from you soon!

I have an keen interest in bicycles and I used to work in the social services sector in social housing.  Since stopping work because of my disability (anxiety) I have found cycling a very effective therapy, and one that I feel many people can benefit from as long as they have a functioning bike.  I am still community minded and would appreciate the opportunity to contribute.
I have a keen interest in bikes, whether it's riding them or installing new parts and I'm hoping to one day be a mechanic for a bike shop.
I love working with bikes and would like to Work in the industry
I love bikes :)
Help out while learning new skills

I've always been a keen bike rider and am interested in cycling culture around the world. I've got some spare time up my sleeve at the moment and would like to learn some practical bike mechanic skills so that I can do my own bike maintenance and also help out others in the community too.
Seeking to learn more about bicycle maintenance. I've been catching the 'bicycle bug' and like to bring second hand bikes back to life.

I own 2 BMX bikes, one of them needs fixing up and I would like to learn how to do it myself.
I love riding for fun and for exercise and its also my main mode of transport.
I also would like to learn new skills and meet new people, while doing something I enjoy.
Practice and improve my bicycle skills
I want to learn how to fix bikes and I reaz like repairing stuff. Also the project you do is really cool.
Wanting to learn more about working on bikes while doing my bit to help out in the community!

I want to gain more experience and skills in bicycle repair to upgrade my skills for employment as I am thinking about trying to get back into the workforce. i have studied engineering and have a lot of experience and interest in mechanical and electrical projcts -building things and taking them apart. i also want to get used to being around other people
Keen to gain knowledge and expierence

I reckon that Melbourne is too polluted and busy, spreading the bike culture could only bring something good to this city. Your organisation share my same vision and I find that is a very good idea what you are doing. I also be happy to learn something new about the mechanics of this awesome way to move.

Reynold was working with Good Cycles and he has reached the end of his program and now needs to find something else to do. We (Good Cycles) suggested the Back to Bikes volunteer program as an option and Reynold agreed to give it a go.

Donovan will be bringing Reynold around to Back to Bikes on Monday the 2nd of October to introduce him.

Kelly Latham - Good Cycles
Wanting to help out and learn about bikes
Gain new skills in my spare time.
Want to help out the unfortunate whilst gaining much needed knowledge ðŸ˜Š

I am semi retired and was interested in doing volunteer work this year. I also would like to  learn more about bike maintenance which I could achieve helping out at your organisation.

I have volunteered at other organisations and appreciate the commitment required.
Altruism and to learn bicycle mechanic skills.

As part of school community service program.

I'm in Year 9 (14 years old) and attending Simonds Catholic College.  This community service program runs from 22 February, for 16 weeks (excluding exam period), on Wednesday afternoons.

I love biking and would love to volunteer at Back2Bikes, learn better bike maintenance skills and be able to use this to give back to the community.

Please let me know as soon as possible if there is an opportunity to volunteer at Back2Bikes.

Thank you
Nicholas Tu

Want to learn how to use my hands! I hope to start here and understand biking mechanics and physics, and eventually move onto engines. I will be going to Europe in 4 months time, so while it may be short I hope to be able to contribute - I think it's a great organisation.
Enjoy riding and working with bicycles
I volunteered over a few weeks with a similar organisation in Berlin, repairing and giving bikes to refugees. Would be keen to help get people out of cars and get those in need on a bike!

Hi,

It would be good to be able to help more people get on the road on a bike, rather than in a car.

It would be especially useful to learn how to repair more complex bikes e.g. tri-bikes for special needs kids.

I will likely come in today around 3:30pm.

Cheers,
Ariel
Likes to work with mechanical things
Works with mechanical things
To learn bike maintenance

I've recently taken up cycling due to finishing yr 12 and the maintenance of them after deciding to purchase a 1970 Raleigh Twenty, it was in a non working condition and I am in the process of building it back up with the help of Sheldon Browns Amazing website as well as the forums.

My current bicycle is a giant, which is sort of a joke since it is a folding bike with 14" wheels.
I have put some cat eye lights on it to make the trips home safer.
I ride this to the station and from southern cross to work, I get some compliments from strangers which really makes my day a whole lot better.
I have heard that the low quality bicycles should be avoided but not everyone can afford such expensive bikes, especially folding bikes.

I am looking to get more hands on as I don't have any specialised tools, and want to learn more about putting bikes together, especially cycles with multiple speeds.

I would love to volunteer once a week on Mondays or Thursday's.

I look forward to hearing from you guys soon!

Cheers

Hi, I'd really like to volunteer as I am passionate about bikes.  I believe they bring so much joy to a person's life and can provide independence and create opportunities.  I ride bikes myself and would love to help out in any way particularly with bike maintenance.  I have basic skills but would like to improve!

I do work full time but I am available to donate my time at the weekends.  I get one day off from work as an ADO and would help out then.
Thanks
Fats

1. Renew my knowledge/skills in bike maintenance
2. Fix our 2 bikes, which I have been putting off for a year
3. I have time (retired) so I think it's a good thing for me and to support what you do.
(didn't know Back2Bikes existed until now)

Just talked with Jeff / Geoff on mobile Thurs 13 April, 10:15AM
To learn something new
Keen to help and also work with like minded people
To learn some maintenance skills and hopefully through that get more people on bikes

I have just recently move here from the US (brought my bicycle!).  I am looking for some volunteer opportunities to keep me busy, while I search for a job.  I am knowledgeable on the basics of bike repair (I can fix a flat, replace a chain, adjust brakes and move and adjust the seat, handle bars, etc) and would love to learn more and use my knowledge to help you out.

Thank you,
Kelly Burke
I wish to learn more about bicycles and how to fix them. If I can help other people at the same time, then it's all for the best!

Hello. I am originally from Mexico. I started commuting by cycling in university. I then lived in Japan for 8 months and it continued, but there travelled with my bicycle on trains and visited nearby towns and cities. Now that I live in Australia I want to do cycle touring and day trips and encourage friends and people around to spend more time.in 2 wheels. If I volunteer I could have a small participation in a helping people I don't know to do things I believe and want to preach.

Hello,

I am a Londoner staying in Melbourne for a few months before going to Cambridge University in October where my primary mode of transport will be my bicycle for the next several years! I have been using my bicycle for my commute for a while now but know very little about how it works and would love to improve my understanding and be able to fix and maintain my bike myself with some confidence. Finding myself with heaps of free time over the winter I would love to volunteer, to learn from you guys and hopefully be of help in fixing up bikes at your workshop.

If you want to know anything else about me, just ask!

Thanks,

Hattie
I would love to have a trade ability to work, but moreover, I am passionate about commuting on a bike.
I have just finished building/restoring an old road-racer and enjoyed it, so thought I would like to learn more and also do a bit of volunteering.
To learn how to fix bikes

I am keen to make a career from being a bike mechanic.  I have undertaken both a Level I and Level II Certificate Bike Mechanic course with the Velo Academy which provided me training in the use of advanced mechanical techniques and specialist tools to strip down and re-build a bicycle, perform an advanced level service and deliver an exceptional sales experience.

I have experience in all aspects of bike assembly, maintenance, adjustment and troubleshooting through maintaining and adjusting my family's bikes.  I am now after "work experience" in the field to further support my development, gain industry experience and to add to my resume for assistance in gaining full time employment in the industry.  With this volunteer opportunity, I see as a win-win, the community gains the outputs of my labour and I gain experience.
So i can do bike repairs, bike sales, make friends
More community involvement and to learn new skills.

I am a fitter and machinist by trade, therefore I have transferable skills I could use to help out those less fortunate than myself by volunteering. I also like to tinker with mechanical things. Also the idea of 'recycling' bikes rather than disposing of them is appealing to me.
To learn, to maintain, to teach, to volunteer
I really want to learn how to fix, maintain, assemble and build bikes so I can have a career.
learn something - make connections - do something for the community
Want to learn more about fixing bikes and bike maintenance
Do something for community...

I love working on and restoring bikes and would love to do it more often.

Back 2 Bikes is the perfect opportunity as it will allow me to get involved with the neighborhood (as I just moved here), allow me to keep building my skills with bicycles and also help encourage people to cycle more!

Please give me a call, I am available to help out after hours weekdays and saturdays.

Thanks a lot, I am looking forward to hearing from you.

Maurice
I would like to learn how to fix bikes and also give back to the community by fixing other people's bikes.
I love bikes and i have time
To help out and to repair bikes
You've got a great program.  I love bikes and working on them, and I've got the time to help out at the moment.

Hello!Sir!
Glad find this chance can repair & building bicycle.I just come to Autralia one month,last job also work at bike shop in my country.

I can repair & building bicycle by myself. If you are insteresting give me a phone call or messenge please. Thank you!

I am passion about Cyling industry!
Wanted to learn about bikes and help out the community
Very interested in learning more about bike maintenance.

I'm an enthusiast who loves touring and wants to know more about repairing bike with the opportunity to assist others.

Currently, I repair old bike in my spare time: most need just basic servicing (wheels, brakes and gears) and greasing of hubs, BB and steering head.  As I have a background in motorcycles, none of this is too daunting.  However, I aim to grow my skills to a professional level over time.

I appreciate the non-for-profit spirit underpinning Back2Bikes. I look forward to learning and sharing skills with the assistance of Back2Bikes.

Regards

Roger Dawson

I had been working on bicycle suspension company for 4 years before I start my Master in RMIT in 2015. In order to develop my skills to learn more about bicycle, I have been looking for any opportunities for several months until I find back2bikes provides volunteer for people who would like to learn and help, it is a great idea that doing something we love and contribute to society.
Please feel free to contact me if you are still looking for volunteers.

Many thanks

Webber
Get bored on summer holiday. Looking fir something to do

I love learning to fix my own bikes and have spent some time in community bike workshops in the past, which have been a great resource. They've helped me a lot in the past and I want to become practised enough to help others. My interest in bikes and repairs is motivated by sustainability and accessibility, it's also heaps of fun. I'd like to build up my skills to work as a bike mechanic one day.
better than doing nothing.
To learn the skills to take care of my own bike
I would like to learn more about cycle mechanics and I'm a firm believer of Back2Bikes' cause.

When I ride my lowriders I'm free, all problems have gone, I'd love to learn my skills putting bikes together, I build me and my dog a lowrider with trailer for him that has a car CD player all from recycled items. I work in port Phillip doing hard waste collections or dumped rubbish and can help with a lot of bikes! I hate sending some to be crushed
Bike junkie i like messing with le velo
Volunteer option with something that actually interests me.

Moved here with partner. Currently unemployed. Always been keen on bikes but generally a little hopeless at their maintenance. Would like to get the skills and have plenty of time to offer as a volunteer for what seems an excellent initiative!

I do a lot of bike riding and I know some of the basic things about bike maintenance but I would like to learn more about how bikes work. This sound like a good place to develop my knowledge about bikes.
interrest in bicycles ,contact inproving bike repair skills
A life time interest in bikes and cycling and now (recently) retired with plenty of time !
I want to work in a bike shop to see if I would like to do it full time, i am here in Melbourne till the end of April on a tourist visa

Volunteering with Back2Bikes is a great opportunity to combine two goals I have for the year.

The first is to volunteer for a good cause. I recently started working 0.8 FTE and am keen to put my extra day (Thursday) to use trying new things, exploring interests and contributing.

The second is to learn how to build and fix bikes. I've been a keen cyclist (commuter and sometime weekend warrior) for the past eight years. I love riding and believe strongly in the physical, mental and environmental benefits of cycling. That said, I'm don't know an awful lot about working with bikes so am looking forward to addressing this.
community work & to learn
I will most likely have some free time on Saturdays at the time you open and would like to learn and help out. I was there today and got my left crank arm fixed fast and easy.

Hello, I am on working holiday visa, but I plan on staying Melbourne a while. I am in the process of buying a bike, trying to find a cheap one on Gumtree and then fixing it up. I don't have much skills with working with bikes, but I am willing to do my best. Contact me if you guys need help. I find working on bikes fascinating.
Cheers thanks Dylan
To gain skills towards empowering self and transfering knowledge to other members and beneficiaries in my NGO in Africa "Kardinia Hope Foundation"

I am currently volunteering elsewhere running an art class and some committee work but want to do another half day or so a week. I have always fixed my own bikes and i used to be a trade qualified carpenter so am very practical and capable. I have a few health probs that make standing or sitting or walking all day impossible but bike maintenance will be ok if i can use a stool or chair sometimes. V keen person! Kat
Currently have some time on my hands, and keen to get my skills up! Really interested in the mechanics of bikes
I'd like to learn more about bike mechanics and it's all for a good cause.
Learning and entering in contact with Melbourne and bicycle
I like building things and learning about bikes
I heard about a purple Peugeot fold up.
Bike is part of my passion and I want to contribute something to community.

To meet other people passionate about bikes and to become more involved in the Melbourne bicycle community. To advance my own mechanical skills to a point of independence and possibly employment as a mechanic.

Love bikes, riding them and fixing them.
Want to help out and learn more about bike repair and maintenance.
I currently work 2 days per week (semi retired) and so have some spare time to volunteer.
Thanks,
Eric
Want to learn how to maintain and fix bicycles as well as to help others with theirs. Keen to learn something new. I currently have a 'cyclocross' bicycle (not listed within options :) )
I love bikes and love the idea of having our work benefit the community. A strong component of wanting to volunteer is to learn bicycle mechanic skills.
To gain bike knowlegde and skils.
To help out others.
the love of bikes
Wanna become a paid bicycle mechanic...
Want to gain knowledge about bicycle, the parts and everything regarding bicycles.
I would like to learn more about bike maintenance and also contribute to a worthy organisation :)
want to go on bike mech course offered for cert

I am a bike mechanics in Vietnam. I don't have qualifications but I can fix any bikes.
After 25 years of employment as software engineer, I want to give back something to the community.
I would like to volunteer 1 or 2 days per week.

Best regards,
/ Tom.
I would like to build my own bike so I can start bike riding around Melbourne and to work at SKINC
interested in learning how to fix bikes
To learn something new and help others
Learn how to repair and service a bike.
To lern mybike!
Happy to help now i am newly retired
Learn to fix own bike & help community
Fill the time and gain more experience, and its my hobby
Learn about maintenance bike
Want to learn more about bicycle mechanics before long distance bike tour
Wanted to deepend my skils after doing the bike maintenance course here
helping out and learning new skill
Like bikes and want to learn skills

I have been riding for over 50 years and love bikes. To and from work and generally commuting throughout Melbourne. I also would like to promote cycling to others.

Although I do a fair amount of general maintenance on my cycle. I would like to eventually be a bike mechanic and learn all aspects of cycle repair. I come from a locksmith background so I am very technically minded.

Cheers

Peter Glaser

I did an 11 week night course last year with Bicycle Training Australia to quantifiy my maintenance experience.

Currently working full time, however, I do get R.D.O's which I would like to use volunteering to gain hands on experience in a work shop environment.

I am able to volunteer this coming Monday 27/4/2015.


Kind regards.
Gary.

I'm between jobs at the moment (financial services exec) and volunteering with you would be one way to help others, stay occupied (you can't job search all day every day), and add to my bike maintenance skills.

I'm also a passionate cyclist, involved as an organiser for a charity bike ride, and raise money for charity by cleaning bikes (I'm pretty good at it). Improving my bike maintenance skills would be handy, and who knows, maybe I should become a bike mechanic!

To help people in need by repairing their bikes.

Learn more about bike maintenance.

Meet new people.
Ian interested in learning how to fix and maintain bikes.
A bike enthusiast looking to expand my bike skills to help promote biking

I like working with bikes and this is a way of giving back to the community.

I also take the vision impaired on tandem rides.

Hi, I am passionate about bike riding and feel that bike riding should be accessible to everybody.  I would like to help out, fix up bikes and along the way learn valuable maintenance skills.  I do work full time Mon-Fri but can offer my time during evenings and weekends.

Cheers,

Fats
I want to get back into riding bikes and maintaining them.

I love riding and working on bicycles.  Having now completed about 10 rebuids, I'd like to continue working on bikes to benefit the community.  I am also an advocate for recycling [anything] and I think this attitude suits the ethos of 'back to bikes'.

Until recently I was a public servant [for 23 years] but left the job and would now like to pursue my passion for bikes, volunteering with like minded people.

Keen to learn some new bike maintenance skills.
To meet others in my local area who are into bike riding.
To contribute to local community by building bikes for people who are disadvantaged.
Interested to learn how to fix/maintain bikes and have a better appreciation for the hardware.

I have time to spare and I like bike riding. Volunteering to help restore or fix bikes will fill some time in with an activity I like and help my well-being.

I have also volunteered to help the Ride to Conquer Cancer. I have an opportunity to combine bike riding with the volunteering if I can improve my bike maintenance skills. So if I can help with bike maintenance with your organisation then that will help me to improve my bike maintenance skills and allow me to further help the RidetoConquerCancer team.

Hoping to speak to you soon.

Kind Regards,
Allan
Keen cyclist , wanting to learn more about maintaining bikes
I like bikes!!

I bought 2 bikes recently at Back2Bikes and I found the project really interesting.
I have some freetime for the time being and I would be very happy to volunteer as I was invited to when I bought and helped to fine tune my bike.
I am quite handy and when younger, I used to fix/customise my BMX.
I am sure it is going to be fun to help you out.
See ya maybe.
Michael
Love of riding bikes, want to focus on something bigger than myself

I am already volunteering at Bikes For Life where fellow volunteer Steve mentioned Back2Bikes.

Am enrolled in a Bicycle Training Australia course (self-funded) in August and would like to broaden my practical experience on maintenance of classic and road bikes.

Overall, I enjoy volunteering, meeting new people with a shared passion for bikes.  Am even considering an eventual career-change into cycle tourism or start my own bike business.

Thanks,
Michael.
Love bikes.

I am an American recently relocated to Melbourne on a working holiday visa.  I have worked as a bike mechanic in the States for a few years now and being the season that it is, I'm finding it hard to break into the market around here.  I thought I could volunteer my skills a little to keep them sharp.  No need for training either, I left my last mechanic job less than a month ago.  Maybe I could teach some classes even? I'm available at times so let me know when you need some help!

Cheers,
Ethan
Just love it
Love it

Help out plus learn valuable skills.
I'd also like to complete a certificate & teach my children.

1. To assist your organisation's mission of providing bikes for needy people.

2. To gain additional skills in bicycle mechanic with the aim of seeking job opportunity in this industry.
Contribute to comunity, social interaction and to learn

I now work part-time and have spare time for volunteering. I am helping out at the Footscray Community Bike Shed (https://www.facebook.com/footscraycommunitybikeshed). However, I need more skills in fixing/servicing a wide range of bikes/parts I am unfamiliar with. I am purchasing a complete tool set so I can practice at home.

I typically don't work Wed - so that is my best day currently for volunteering.

Cheers
Adrian
Looking to be active within the community, and doing something positive while learning about bike maintenance.

I want to use my time to help other people and learn  basic bike maintenance skill. I am a beginner and willing to learn new skill if you will allow me. I will be available around last week of February or early March. Thank you for considering my application. God bless.
Keen to help. Love bikes
Love cycling and want to learn more about the mechanics of the bicycle
To improve personal skills in bicycle repair and maintenance, and promote cycling as a primary mode of transportation.
To help and learn
I understand the basics of maintaining a bike but would like to learn more so I can build, restore and maintain Our bikes at home.

I did freestyle BMX semi professional and downhill mountain biking for 6 years and during that time also worked in a bike shop servicing customer bikes and maintaining my own bikes as well, I've always had an itch to pick up the tools again and have a play around with bikes and I figure volunteering my time to help others is a great way to give back to something that helped me enjoy what I did for those few years
Learn as much as possible with a non profit organisation specialising in bike repairs and helping the community
A passion for bikes  fill in some time and meet new people  also to give to community and learn skill to help me and others on bike mechanics.

Hi there,
I would really love to volunteer for the program for several reasons. I have always loved bikes - from my first bmx (a Repco Hotfoot 2) up to now - where I have three bikes I have mostly put together myself from found or bought parts. I have never had a drivers license because I have never needed one - I have my bike and that is how I like to travel. I have always had a hands on DIY attitude whether it be building and fixing my bikes to building and fixing computers - for myself and friends. I had been looking at the Bike Maintenance course that used to be around but I think has since been shut down for a few years. As I am   unemployed at the moment I came across your site and thought it would be a great opportunity to fill in the gaps in my experience and to have achieved something for the day that I can see and touch and will potentially make someone very happy. I am also extremely interested in the Advanced Maintenance course you mention on your site and am going to apply for it. I see alot of perfectly rideable bikes being thrown away around South and Port Melbourne and I strongly believe in recycling (no pun intended) and using what you have to work with. I am good with my hands, learn fast have a genuine love for bikes and riding and would love to learn some new skills while putting what I already know to good use.

I always wanted to do a volunteer job and now I feel that is the time to do my first step. I love bikes and I would like to play a new role in the community trying to provide a positive impact on the lives of others.

I want to learn and develop new skills, and expands my experience contributing to a cause IÂ´m passionate about.
To learn about bikes/be able to work on my own

I'm a volunteer at Bikes 4 Life and have been helping them repair bikes for the past 3 months. I've always been pretty handy with bikes and I am a regular rider. Naturally, there's always more that I can learn about bike repairs and after speaking to Robin at B4L yesterday, I'm keen to help your organisation to fix bikes and at the same time, pick up some new skills that will make me a more useful contributor at B4L. I'm currently between contracts and would be available most Mondays and Thursdays.
I thought this is a good way to learn how to look after my bike while also helping others to get a good bike and save some bikes that would otherwise be tipped.

I Love bikes!!! And I love taking care of them, especially the unloved ones.
When I lived in Boston (Massachusetts), I used to go to auctions to buy abandoned bikes, fix them for cheap and re-sell them to students for a very reasonable price.
I hope I can keep on fixing bikes (I've already fixed the one that came with the house I live in, so I'm running out of opportunities!!)

It brings together 2 of my interests: bikes and reusing/recycling what more can I say!
interested in learning to fix bikes, and contributing something positive to the community.
To be able to fix my own bike
Love bikes, want to learn more about how to fix them and maintain them
My love for bikes and to be able to work on my personal bikes. Also to gain volunteer hours for a school program I participate in.
improve my bike skills and communication skills

I love cycling, but I don't have much experience with bike maintenance.  I am very keen to learn though!  I would very much like to help out in the bike repair workshop.  I think the skills learned from working in a bike shop would be incredibly useful and having fun working in a friendly team environment will be rewarding.  But most of all, I just really enjoy helping people.  I truly support the mission of Back2Bikes.  What a great cause!
I like fixing bikes :)

Introduced to B2B by my cousins Marty and Michael Collins. Have had an infatuation with bikes since about 10 years old (heavily influenced by Marty), quite a bit of experience in bike maintenance (professionally and otherwise) and would appreciate the opportunity put all this together to help out a little if I can.

Mike twisted my arm!!!!!   and held out a carrot!!!!

Am doing maintenance course with Mike and enjoying it.  I am now retired and we thought I could get involved work on the bikes , learn and be part of the crew.  Interested to be part where there is a shared interest and a friendly bunch to hang out with.   Will come along to meet on Thursday 16th and will bring my own lunch. Cheers Henry
I am currently between jobs and would like to spend some time volunteering particularly in an area that I am passionate about.

Hi!

I'm interested in volunteering in the workshop. I tend to view cycling as a practical, cheap, healthy and environmentally friendly way of getting around. I'm not much of tourer/racer.

I recently quit my unfulfilling full-time office job with the intent of picking up casual work and getting more involved in my local community.  Back 2 Bikes is one way that I'd like to do this. I don't have much in the way of existing skills but I'm keen to learn and have plenty of free time at the moment to lend a hand.

I have a working with Children's Check (if that's required) and I'm available most weekdays.

Hope to hear back!

Pat
Great cause.  Keen to help out.  Also keen to learn about bike maintenance.
Want learn basic bike maintenance
